idea-plugin.name: HTTP Client Plus
idea-plugin.description:
HTTP Client Plus provides a Postman-like UI for composing and sending HTTP requests directly inside IntelliJ IDEA. Requests are saved as native .http files, making them portable, shareable, and version-controlled.

Key Features
  • Method selector and URL field with an inline Send button.
  • Mandatory Name field used as the .http filename and for tracking/updating existing files.
  • Params tab with a key–value table that automatically appends to the URL.
  • Headers tab with a key–value table.
  • Body tab with a Content-Type selector and a compact overflow menu (Beautify JSON).
  • Multipart form-data builder with boundary input and parts table (text or file) supporting Content-Type per part.
  • For POST requests, automatically adds Content-Type: application/json if missing.
  • Each Send saves or updates the .http file; the first Send opens it, later Sends refresh if already open.
  • No separate Save/Retry buttons — Send handles persistence only (execution is manual).
Usage
  • Open via Tools → Open HTTP Client Plus.
  • Fill in Name, URL, Params/Headers/Body as needed, then click Send to save.
  • Run the request manually from the editor with Ctrl+Enter.
  • Files are stored under http-client-plus/collections in your project.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
1.0.5

  • Added support for Response File saving and viewing within the tool window.
  • Fixed an issue where the tool window might not open on the first attempt.
  • Improved error handling for file operations.

1.0.4

  • Added support for custom Content-Type headers in multipart form-data requests.
  • Improved UI responsiveness when switching between tabs.

1.0.3

  • Fixed a bug where the Params tab did not correctly append parameters to the URL.
  • Enhanced validation for the Name field to prevent invalid filenames.

1.0.2

  • Added a Beautify JSON option in the Body tab's overflow menu.
  • Improved error messages for failed HTTP requests.

1.0.1

  • Initial release with core features including method selector, URL field, Params/Headers/Body tabs, and file saving functionality.
